name: MisConflict
description:
Play Online

You always wanted to try yourself in diplomacy and strategy competition with friends? You're annoyed by text chats, because they're breaking your experience? So this is the game for you!

You can fight each other, crate alliances and diplomatic voice meetings, and finally have fun!

And remember: you're Stronger Together!

How to play:

- First of all you have to download the game. - Then you need join our discord server (the link is in the main menu of the game).
- Then you have to sign up, and pls, remember your pussword! (^_^)
- After that you can just click "play" and create a private room for 2-10 players.
- Just call your friends to join the game, and when the given number of players is reached the game starts!

- As you can see on one of the screenshots there's a lot of buttons, read the description of each single button carefully before you start to play.
- Small rectangles on the map tiles are armies. Their color depends on who own them, as well as tiles do. Here's the color scheme: Green - you Yellow - your allies Red - your enemies Gray - Neutral None - free tile
- You can left click on an army to move it. You can teleport it whatever you want within your territories, your allies territories and nearby tiles.
- To move any armies you should have turns. Turns counter is in the left-top corner of the screen. It increases by 1 each 5 seconds.
- You can right click on an army to split it by 2.
- If you put army to a free tile, neutral player's tile or enemies tile you'll claim that tile and loose 1 solider of your army. If it was another player's tile you automatically declare a war to him.
- If your army met enemy or neutral army they fight.
- The tile with nickname of the player is his capital.
- If you capture player's capital you defeat him and claim all his tiles and armies.
- You can crate an alliance and invite people there. Allies can't fight each other and can move within each other tiles.
- You can join common voice chat of the room and speak to your enemies.
- You can invite people to a private voice chat, you can do like diplomacy meeting.
- If you're the only one player left in the room - congrats, you're the winner! Now you can restart the game and play again!
- If there's more players left and they haven't enough armies to fight each other, so the friendship is the real winner! So just restart the game and start again!
